stephen.goal: Schedule a one-hour meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits everyone's schedules.

edward.goal: Schedule a one-hour meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits everyone's schedules.

angela.goal: Schedule a one-hour meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits everyone's schedules.

orchestrator.goal: Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem for FastDownwards that schedules a one-hour meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 consistent with all participants' availabilities.

public_information: All participants work between 09:00 and 17:00 on Monday.
Time slots are considered in 30 minute granularity for planning purposes.
There exists at least one solution that fits everyone's existing schedule.

availability.system_prompt: You are an expert in calendar analysis. Using your private schedule and the public meeting constraints, compute all available time windows on Monday within work hours that are at least 60 minutes long. Present the result as a clear list of start-end times and do not produce PDDL.
availability.prompt: Your name is stephen. Use the public information and your private schedule to list all candidate one-hour slots on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that are free for you. If information is missing, state what is missing instead of making assumptions.

availability.system_prompt: You are an expert in calendar analysis. Using your private schedule and the public meeting constraints, compute all available time windows on Monday within work hours that are at least 60 minutes long. Present the result as a clear list of start-end times and do not produce PDDL.
availability.prompt: Your name is edward. Use the public information and your private schedule to list all candidate one-hour slots on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that are free for you. If information is missing, state what is missing instead of making assumptions.

availability.system_prompt: You are an expert in calendar analysis. Using your private schedule and the public meeting constraints, compute all available time windows on Monday within work hours that are at least 60 minutes long. Present the result as a clear list of start-end times and do not produce PDDL.
availability.prompt: Your name is angela. Use the public information and your private schedule to list all candidate one-hour slots on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that are free for you. If information is missing, state what is missing instead of making assumptions.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL modeling for the FastDownwards planner. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that model scheduling a one-hour meeting for the participants on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 using the provided availability reports. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the PDDL is compatible with FastDownwards and uses an appropriate time or discretized-slot representation. Keep any participant-specific actions or resources distinct if modeling multiple agents.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You received the availability lists from each participant. Combine the public information, the participants' availability reports, and the global goal to construct a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards that finds a valid one-hour meeting slot. If participant reports conflict or use different naming for the same concept, reconcile them and document assumptions in comments within the PDDL problem. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> tags and the problem in <problem></problem> tags.
